3f62b514-d592-46db-812c-f7d4585e33b2.description: This badge is part of a 2-day workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Christina Fillmore (GSK), Ellis Hughes (GSK), and Thomas Neitmann (Roche) that covered how to work with the Tidyverse and the first generation of Pharmaverse tools in order to ‘deliver’ typical clinical trial displays. Users used R packages admiral, tplyr & tfrmt to go from SDTM all the way through to table generation. Users went through a end-to-end focusing on a sample of demographic, safety and efficacy summaries.
3f62b514-d592-46db-812c-f7d4585e33b2.name: Clinical Reporting in R

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Using R to Derive Robust Insights from Real-World Health Care Data at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives in RStudio Cloud.

c9f1be87-f33a-48e9-9e8b-7054c40e5b5c.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Eric Nantz (Eli Lilly) that covered how essential workflows, best practices, and the expanding community of Shiny-related packages can help you with Shiny development. Students learned how to manage requests for enhancements and how to include Shiny apps in a production pipeline or process. The workshop covered software development best practices for Shiny developers to help them climb the ladder of Shiny development.
c9f1be87-f33a-48e9-9e8b-7054c40e5b5c.name: Building Production-Quality Shiny Applications

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Introduction to {shinyValidator} at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

6aa09a98-839a-4483-9330-30692a09a07a.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Dinakar Kulkarni (Roche) & Ben Straub (GSK) that covered why CI/CD has a pivotal role in ensuring that R packages in Pharma meet the highest standards. Students implemented 8 different CI/CD workflows on a dummy R package available on GitHub. Covered CI/CD pipelines for R package development & integrity as well as best practices. Students setup a GitHub repo with pipelines to develop an understanding of why CI/CD is essential.
6aa09a98-839a-4483-9330-30692a09a07a.name: An Intro to CI/CD for R Packages

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed An Intro to CI/CD for R Packages at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

cea3172c-b52e-46ab-907e-9bd50fa31e70.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma that covered testing Shiny applications in production projects by Marcin Dubel (Appsilon). Attendees learned how to set the correct architecture and automate the process. Main testing concepts were covered including setting up an efficient testing environment. Users completed hands-on exercises on building unit tests, data validation, integration tests, frontend tests, and performance tests.
cea3172c-b52e-46ab-907e-9bd50fa31e70.name: How to Build Shiny Testing Architecture

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed How to Build Shiny Testing Architecture at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

d30ccb88-55e7-49b2-8a5c-d61ca37965f8.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma that covered an introduction to Shiny for Python by Ryan Johnson (RStudio). Shiny makes it easy to build interactive web applications with the power of Python’s data and scientific stack. In this session, attendees learned how to write applications in Python.
d30ccb88-55e7-49b2-8a5c-d61ca37965f8.name: Shiny for Python

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Shiny for Python at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

94c83012-3189-48b0-8717-90d21f8f27dd.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Adrian Waddell & Gabriel Becker (Genentech) that covered the rtables R package to create tables used to analyze/report clinical trials data. Attendees studied the stages of creating a publication-ready table, including cell value derivation, table formatting, working with titles/footnotes, table pagination, & rendering tables to an output format. Lastly, tern package was used for the creation of standard tables used in clinical trials.
94c83012-3189-48b0-8717-90d21f8f27dd.name: Creating Submission-Quality Clinical Trial Reporting Tables in R - rtables

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Creating Submission-Quality Clinical Trial Reporting Tables in R - rtables at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

ab43aaf7-a636-4de1-96ad-0f2531cd4ae1.description: This badge is part of a workshop series from Open Source in Pharma taught by Shannon Pileggi & Daniel Sjoberg (Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center) that covered how to make standard regulatory tables & table shells for clinical research using the {gtreg} package in R. Students learned about adverse event tables, summary tables with multi-line statistics for continuous variables, and raw data listings tables with grouped data. Table elements, styling tweaks, and output formats were covered.
ab43aaf7-a636-4de1-96ad-0f2531cd4ae1.name: Introducing {gtreg}: An R Package to Produce Regulatory Tables for Clinical Research

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Introducing {gtreg}: An R Package to Produce Regulatory Tables for Clinical Research at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

f2c42805-f96b-4750-b0db-8268cffdefb0.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma that covered a walk-through of the new addition of drill-down capabilities in the pharmaverse package Tplyr. Mike Stackhouse, Eli Miller, and Andrew Bates of Atorus helped learners explore the underlying structure of how Tplyr produces data, and how metadata are captured behind the scenes to support traceability of results. Attendees created Shiny applications that leverage Tplyr’s drill-down capabilities.
f2c42805-f96b-4750-b0db-8268cffdefb0.name: Drill Down Summary Tables in Shiny with Tplyr

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Drill Down Summary Tables in Shiny with Tplyr at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

fdb8ab7c-9b66-493b-be18-7530490779ed.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Rich Iannone (RStudio) that covered data quality and data documentation workflows with the pointblank package. Attendees learned about functions that allow users to: (1) quickly understand a new dataset (2) validate tabular data using rules that are based on our understanding of the data (3) fully document a table by describing its variables and other important details.
fdb8ab7c-9b66-493b-be18-7530490779ed.name: How to Use Pointblank to Understand, Validate, and Document Your Data

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed How to Build Shiny Testing Architecture at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

6e1083f7-88ba-4dc2-8357-7391e7eab3f3.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by David Granjon (Novartis) that covered how to make Shiny apps production-ready, particularly for GxP usage. Students learned about {shinyValidator}, a Novartis open-source R package, compiling most of the testing levels in a single report. Students learned how to setup {shinyValidator} in an existing/new project , write unit & server tests, manipulate a headless app with shinytest2, take snapshots, & interpret {shinyValidator} report.
6e1083f7-88ba-4dc2-8357-7391e7eab3f3.name: Introduction to {shinyValidator}

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Introduction to {shinyValidator} at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

92474948-40aa-417c-b64d-002bc82c074c.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Zichen Wang, Tatsuya Arai & Vassilis N. Ioannidis (Amazon) that covered the types of biomedical graphs/networks, the underlying biological and medical problems, & the applications of graph ML algorithms for solving those problems important for drug discovery. Core topics were reviewed such as training & fine-tuning GNN models, macro-molecule property & function prediction on residue graphs, & bi-graph based binding affinity prediction.
92474948-40aa-417c-b64d-002bc82c074c.name: Graph Neural Networks in Drug Discovery: Opportunities and Solutions

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Graph Neural Networks in Drug Discovery: Opportunities and Solutions at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives

9d1a1270-6958-48bf-825c-33ea85ad285b.description: This badge is part of a workshop series from Open Source in Pharma taught by Jose Storopoli (Associate Professor and Researcher of the Department of Computer Science at Universidade Nove de Julho - UNINOVE). The introduction to Julia workshop covered the following: How to download and install Julia for Windows, Mac and Linux, How to use Julia in various environments, such as VSCode, How to install and uninstall packages General overview of the Julia syntax and how to write programs.
9d1a1270-6958-48bf-825c-33ea85ad285b.name: Introduction to Julia

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Introduction to Julia at Open Source in Pharma by attending in-person and completing 75% of class objectives.

a1897c6d-0e07-41fb-b4a8-a63768879903.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Brian Varney (Experis) that covered hands-on examples of typical clinical programming processes in R. Session was focused on enhancing the clinical programming skill set. Programming processes covered: Creating Variables, Combining Data, Group by Processing, Transposing/Pivoting Data, Handling Duplicates, and Summarizing Data. Attendees used RStudio and Base R and Tidyverse packages for this workshop against example clinical data.
a1897c6d-0e07-41fb-b4a8-a63768879903.name: Coding Typical Clinical Processes Using R for the Entry Level Programmer

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Using R to Derive Robust Insights from Real-World Health Care Data at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

2bbdceeb-1b69-4ac4-83c9-4a2d2b0d3000.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by David Hall (Novartis) that covered how to use JavaScript to significantly enhance the interactivity of Shiny apps by using a proper JavaScript toolchain for non-trivial applications. Students learned about JavaScript tools that enhanced the development of HTMLWidgets. Workshop covered how to set up a complete toolchain and make it work with R code in VS Code, React, Storybook, Yarn, Jest, webpack, and the {reactR} R package.
2bbdceeb-1b69-4ac4-83c9-4a2d2b0d3000.name: How to Use a Complete Javascript Toolchain in Your Shiny Development

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed How to Use a Complete Javascript Toolchain in Your Shiny Development at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

dc1b348e-eca9-47f8-8f65-aa3eac685936.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Julia Mueller (University of Freiburg) that covered Quarto - a new publishing system that lets you seamlessly combine text, code, and code output to create beautifully formatted and easily reproducible articles, presentations, websites, books, and blogs. Students learned about the most important features of Quarto while comparing it to R-Markdown. In the hands-on workshop, students used Quarto along with the instructor's demonstration.
dc1b348e-eca9-47f8-8f65-aa3eac685936.name: A Hands on Introduction to Quarto

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed A Hands-on Introduction to Quarto at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

53505bb6-a628-4564-82e7-57f4a12ce2e4.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Michael Freeman and Allison Horst (Observable) that covered how to quickly build interactive visualizations on the Observable Platform to support their work. Students leveraged a library, Observable Plot to practice constructing visualizations that span from the basic to the bespoke. With real-world data, students learned how to create and share visualizations that reveal meaningful insights in data.
53505bb6-a628-4564-82e7-57f4a12ce2e4.name: Introduction to Observable - Companion Visualization Tool for Your Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Introduction to Observable - Companion Visualization Tool for Your Analysis at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

6020034e-5c88-498b-96c2-62caeb25218c.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Rachael Dempsey (RStudio) that covered how to connect the scientific community at pharma organizations. The workshop also covered how to share resources and information with users. Attendees learned how to foster a community of knowledge sharing among open-source users in pharma. The session highlighted best practices, tools, and case studies of successful strategies.
6020034e-5c88-498b-96c2-62caeb25218c.name: Building a Data Science Community at Your Pharma

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Building a Data Science Community at Your Pharma at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

a18f39db-3d2d-4bac-9cb0-5d39af1f62a5.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Satish Murthy (J&J) and Devin Pastoor (RStudio) that helped students learn about designing, implementing, & scaling open-source architectures for scientific computing environments. Attendees also learned about the challenges that face administrators operating supporting environments as business needs evolve. Students reviewed approaches to better understand & serve programmers. A review of scaling environments and optimizing R code.
a18f39db-3d2d-4bac-9cb0-5d39af1f62a5.name: Admin - Clinical Environment Management

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Admin - Clinical Environment Management at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

4f9ba7be-be0b-4640-89e5-39b641df6434.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Daniel Lee (Stan Developer) that helped Stan practitioners gain a deeper understanding of what's going on under the hood. Students reviewed topics such as: lp__, Computational efficiency by considering the automatic differentiation stack, debugging Stan programs, validating assumptions & why violating assumptions degrades performance, the difference between computational efficiency and sampling efficiency and dealing with MCMC output.
4f9ba7be-be0b-4640-89e5-39b641df6434.name: Advanced Stan Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Advanced Stan Workshop at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.

d90287fe-4896-4d66-8736-9a56d8ba970b.description: This badge is part of a workshop at Open Source in Pharma by Nathaniel Phillips (Plinth) that covered a framework and techniques for using R tools, such as the tidyverse & pointblank packages, to assess & derive robust, repeatable insights from real-world data. Students reviewed topics like assessing data for use-case suitability, transforming data into 'tidy' analysis ready data (ARD), & surfacing data provenance so collaborators can understand when patients are included in the final analysis.
d90287fe-4896-4d66-8736-9a56d8ba970b.name: Using R to Derive Robust Insights from Real-World Health Care Data

issuer.summary: issued by Open Source in Pharma

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Using R to Derive Robust Insights from Real-World Health Care Data at Open Source in Pharma by attending in person and completing 75% of class objectives.
